data.author: dalglir
data.description:
Simple, readable time display in a classic Star Trek type font with animated 'warp' starfield (left to right) in the background. 

NOTE: It's a bit of a battery hog - I'm down to one whole day from a full charge - but, y'know, it looks awesome on my Pebble Steel so what else matters? :-]

None of this would be possible without the pioneering programming of Pebble developers Adam C and Chris Lewis. The SimpleTrek watchface is merely a simplified version of Adam C's excellent and more functional STARGAZE watchface which, itself, is built upon Chris Lewis's most excellent STARFIELD SMOOTH watchface and whose source code and hard work I mercilessly and minutely repurposed for this.

Seriously though, you should definitely check the STARGAZE and STARFIELD SMOOTH watchfaces by putting those in the Pebble AppStore search bar right now. They're awesome.
data.title: SimpleTrek

data.author: Orologics

changelog.release_notes: 1.1 Rebuilt for latest system
Demo of the popular Watcfaces+ watch app.

data.description:
This is a demo of Watchfaces+, which you can easily find in the Pebble app store by tapping "See All/More From This Developer"

Every 10 seconds, this demo automatically switches one of the many configurations you can easily change on the full app by using the Select, Up, and Down buttons.

New to Watchfaces+ is the ability to select from over a dozen readable color palettes on the Pebble Time or Pebble Time Steel.

Watchfaces+ also gives new life to older Pebble models, giving you 27 analog watch faces while only using 1 of 8 slots.

If you like this demo, please give it a heart, and don't forget to replace it with Watchfaces+ in the Pebble app store, so you can choose which configurations you prefer.

Watchfaces+ does not need an internet connection to change configuration. it has 27 analog watch faces,  and includes these configurable features, not in this demo: hourly vibrate, bluetooth disconnect monitoring, and battery check.

You can also find Watchfaces+ in the Daily section of the "GET APPS" section of the Pebble app store.

Check out my other apps for mass transit, food trucks, and dual time zones.

latest_release.release_notes: 1.1 Rebuilt for latest system

data.title: Wathfaces+ Color Demo

data.author: Patrick Van Cauteren

changelog.release_notes: Moved location of configuration page because of DropBox's changed policy regarding HTML pages.

Added support for other languages.
Supported languages are: English, Dutch, French, German, Spanish and Italian.

Follow-up of PVC's Essentials.

Just like my Essentials, it is intended to for people that just need the essential information (time, day of the week, day of the month, battery status, bluetooth status) and prefer a bigger font.

Differences with my Essentials are: the font size is now 50pt instead of 42pt, changed layout to fit with the bigger font, and 3 short vibrations when bluetooth connection is lost.

Weekdays are still shown in dutch only.  Will add other languages as soon as I have time to add configuration possibilities.

data.description:
Follow-up of PVC's Essentials.

Just like my Essentials, it is intended to for people that just need the essential information (time, day of the week, day of the month, battery status, bluetooth status) and prefer a bigger font.

Differences with my Essentials are: the font size is now 50pt instead of 42pt, changed layout to fit with the bigger font, and 3 short vibrations when bluetooth connection is lost.

Supported languages for the weekdays are: English, Dutch, French, German, Spanish and Italian.

data.description:
View a mercator projection of the earth tracking the progress of the sun and moon. There are three earth displays: Living Earth, NASA Blue Marble, and Visible Earth.

The International Space Station can also be tracked, and for world travelers you can view your location on our planet.  There are four possible icons: sun, moon, your location (red push-pin), and the ISS (red icon).

There are custom options for date format, screen background, turning on and off the icons, switching between earth images, refresh rate, and more.

Note that ISS tracking is updated twice a minute, which uses phone data and Pebble battery. The most battery-efficient settings are to not track ISS and turn off your GPS location, which means the time updates every minute and the globe recalculates the sunlight areas depending on the refresh setting which has a one-hour default.

latest_release.release_notes: 2.4 Patch for new Pebble Time Android

data.title: Mercator

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: stylish veggie numbers
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:34, 12:59, 20:47

Eco is a watchface about creation, growth, aging, death and recreation. The numbers represent a growing leaf or a fruit. The bigger the digit value, the bigger the digit size. In the end, the lifeform dies and makes place for a new one. As in real life, it's all about regeneration and diversity. The watchface looks different throughout the day and you will find interesting combinations. 

Eco Style is shaded in a fresh green, focusing on the herbal inspiration and staying reduced. 

The original Pebble gets a minimalistic black and white watchface, worthy a separate mention for it's graphical style. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Eco Style

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: stylish veggie numbers
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:34, 12:59, 20:47

Eco is a watchface about creation, growth, aging, death and recreation. The numbers represent a growing leaf or a fruit. The bigger the digit value, the bigger the digit size. In the end, the lifeform dies and makes place for a new one. As in real life, it's all about regeneration and diversity. The watchface looks different throughout the day and you will find interesting combinations. 

Eco Cycle has coloured numbers. It starts with a deep green, turing yellow, going over red to brown and ending in a dead gray before the new number gets born.

The original Pebble gets a minimalistic black and white watchface, worthy a separate mention for it's graphical style.

data.author: shellström

changelog.release_notes: The watchface now generates valid EAN-8 barcodes that you can scan with a compatible reader (try it with your phone)! The format of the time has been modified as well, so now you see the date of month as the first to digits, the time as the following four and checksum as the last. See the app description for more details.
Enabled non-Time Pebble support as well!
Brushed up the graphics
This release should get rid of the problems where digits become blank after a short while
First release! :D\-<

data.description: The recognizable EAN pattern that tells you the time, while still being a valid EAN-8 barcode that you can scan (in supported scanners)! You tell time the following way: [ddHHMM0C] where dd=Day of month, HH=Hour of day, MM=Minute of hour, 0=Not used, C=Checksum for the first seven digits

latest_release.release_notes: The watchface now generates valid EAN-8 barcodes that you can scan with a compatible reader (try it with your phone)! The format of the time has been modified as well, so now you see the date of month as the first to digits, the time as the following four and checksum as the last. See the app description for more details.

data.title: EAN Barcode

Simple watchface with readable digits, nice to battery.

Features:

  - BT connection indicator

  - Hourly vibrations -- optional (reduces battery runtime)
  - Battery indicator
  - Hours can be displayed without leading zero (06 vs 6)

Please give it heart, if you like it. Thank you.

data.description:
Simplified version of PIP BOY 100 by Bert de Ruiter using a cleaner background picture, no accelerometer-XP interaction, and no shake to slide in weather. 

HP is the battery level, XP is the temperature in F, top right is date (static year) and bottom right is time. Upon BT disconnect the right arm cripples. Has 12h and 24h modes based on Pebble settings.

Inspired by Fallout's Pip Boy. Built from SDK tutorial examples, designed first in Canvas long ago and posted on Reddit.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed Bluetooth disconnect failing to trigger crippled graphic. Centered date instead of edge align, that's what I get for making watchfaces on a wednesday.

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: Folded sheet of paper? Yes!
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

I spent some time with origami and I like the idea of creating different things with one sheet of paper. In origami you normally use square paper and for a nice effect the backside can have another color that comes to view here and there. I am using this effect to show the numbers. Since origami does not allow ripping or cutting the paper, the resulting numbers are pretty abstract, but always resemble their originals. You have to pay attention to the revealed brighter backside of the paper. The number 8 is an exception. Still, the paper has to stay intact. So I just folded the diagonals that represent the junction in 8's center.

This watchface is for fans of origami and those who like some arts on their wrist. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Origami

data.author: plan44.ch

changelog.release_notes: Adapted for Pebble Time Round

Changed direction of contrast gradient to be the same for both hour and minute hands, as interestingly, this seems to be much easier to read.

The original version where minutes were dark->light in clockwise direction but hours were dark->light counter-clockwise. Apparently, this made it much harder for the eye/brain to "see" the hands at a single glance.
First release, written to celebrate arrival of my Pebble Time red today!

data.description:
To celebrate the 64 colors of the new Pebble Time display, here's a simple colorful watchface using 60 of them (excluding black, white and gray).

Hint for reading the time: sharpest contrast (yellow to dark blue) represents the hands. To see it more easily, slightly squint, this reduces color vision and enhances visible luminosity contrast.

latest_release.release_notes: Adapted for Pebble Time Round

data.description:
A regular watch, but inside it are a series of dots to indicate the month, week and battery level.

At the top are 12 dots that represent the 12 months with the current month marked in bold red. The 6th dot is selected indicating that it's June.

At the bottom left are 5 dots to indicate battery level.

At the bottom right are 7 dots to indicate the week with the first and last dot being red to indicate Sunday and Saturday respectively. For example, if the 2nd dot is bold, it indicates Monday.

You can change the first dot to be Sunday or Monday in settings.

The second hand is hidden by default to maximize battery life, but you can turn it on in settings.

Customize the colors in settings.

When bluetooth is disconnected, the watch vibrates and shows a bluetooth icon.

Hourly vibrate is set to go off once at noon, but you can set a time range in settings. The vibrate pattern follows the Roman numerals:

3 o'clock = III = short+short+short
6 o'clock = VI = long+short
9 o'clock = IX = IVV = short+long+long
12 o'clock = XII = VVII = long+long+short+short

The hourly vibrate is late by 10 seconds to avoid overlapping with vibrations from calendar events.

latest_release.release_notes: Support for Pebble Time Round

data.title: Voyager

Last graphics tweak before tackling a configuration page to customize many bits!

small graphical tweaks, same great watchface

data.description:
Idea influenced from "ChromaTick", and modified from the "KS Clock Face" code. 

As my eyesight is getting steadily worse, I wanted a watch face I could easily read. A big digital readout would be the most easy, but that's boring; so I mixed digital and analog, and as this is a colour watch, why not use lots of colour? A new colour is revealed every hour (alternates dark/light). I've reduced the number of colours to the most contrasting, and it uses the same colour each hour (customizable with configuration page).

I like it, hopefully you'll find it useful, too.

Sep. 18/16: Now works with Pebble Round. Email me if you have a comment. Thanks!

latest_release.release_notes: Small change to "Peter's Mode" to apply colour changes.

data.title: Old Fogies Can't See Worth S***

data.author: Christopher Waite

changelog.release_notes: - Added data persistence so that the second hand configuration setting is remembered when the watch face restarts

- Added support for 12 and 24 hour style clocks
- Added configuration page with ability to disable the second hand
- Added support for original Pebble

- Fixed a clipping issue with long day names
- Fixed a bug where the current minute bar was ahead by 1 minute (oops!)

- Added graduations along the rows (every 2 hours) to help with the readability of hours
- Fixed bug with bluetooth vibration occurring when returning to the watch face

Sorry for the large number of releases in a short space of time. Nearly there now :)

- The second hand now takes up the full height of the watch mechanism - this aids with readability and looks cool too :)
- Added a bluetooth connection status (top right) which also vibrates on connect/disconnect
- Changed the charging text to '...'
First release. I hope you like it.

data.description:
Equaliser is a new take on telling the time.

It has the following features:

- Battery level display
- Day of the week and date
- Bluetooth connectivity indicator (with vibrate on connect/disconnect)
- Support for 12 and 24 hour time format
- Ability to disable the second hand via the configuration page (to preserve battery life)

How does it work?

Rows fill up from the bottom to the top - Each complete row represents an hour that has passed since midnight.
Columns fill up from left to right - Each column represents a minute that has passed since the previous full hour.
Seconds are represented by the orange line that moves horizontally across the screen. When it reaches the end, a new column is filled in to indicate a complete minute.

There are a few markers to assist with readability. Orange blocks are displayed down the left hand side at every 2 hour increment. The orange horizontal marker represents midday. The black vertical markers are 15 minute increments with the thickest being half past the hour.

Example: 3 rows are filled. A 4th is partially filled just past the first vertical black line. The time is therefore just gone 3:15am.

I hope you enjoy it :)

latest_release.release_notes: - Added data persistence so that the second hand configuration setting is remembered when the watch face restarts

data.title: Equaliser

data.author: Kenny L.

changelog.release_notes: Added Doirite support

Clay support for offline setting changes
Changed from paypal donation to kiezelpay donations.

Added a couple of new settings

-Have a greater control of what animations occur.  Determine just how much battery to use!
-Added in a quiet time for animations for those people who like to sleep with their pebble.  Now don't worry about draining your battery with unnecessary animations!
-Updated to allow for better control over auto-animations with your battery. Now choose any % to stop showing animations! Even 42% is acceptable.

That's really it!  I'd like to add in heath functions, but I just don't know where'd they'd fit in well.
Hopefully fixed some battery issues as well as some crashing issues.

Added Round Support
Fixed things up for the new SDK
Better use of the PNGs.  It should be more efficient now!
Fixed config page

More coming soon!

Minor tweaks added
For now, I'm going to put this one down.  I could not find a good way to add weather.  I'm hoping to work on some other faces, so be on the look out!

Changed Auto Range Input
Added Backlight check for fire burning
Added Version check after config run (only time)

Added adjustable auto-animations
Moved config webpage

Fixed not saving your settings if you exit the watchface.
Added auto stop animations.  If you battery is <20%, animations will stop running.

Configurable now! 
Turn on or off animations
Change vibrations on disconnect and reconnect to bluetooth
More coming!

Added vibrate on connect (No longer does it run every time you open the face)
Changed logo to color (Aplite wasn't displaying it anyway)
Changed Aplite charging icon to hallow heart for better looks

ANIMATIONS ARE HERE!

-Entrance animation
-Fire animation on shake (turn Motion on in your backlight settings for added effect)
-Easter egg animations complete

Huzzah, everything animates now.  On both Aplite and Basalt of course.  I will be working soon on getting the watchface configurable so if you want to save some battery you can turn off animations, but for now, if you would like an animation-less watchface, contact me and I will get you the previous build.
The time was clipping, fixed that
I'll fix it one of these times...
Easter egg was popping up during normal operation.
Shifted date slightly
Cleaned up the code, fixed the time (made it bigger), and removed vibrate on connect.
Added short vibration on reconnect.
Jumped the gun a bit.  Fixed some slight text alignment issues.  Also made it a bit more difficult to accidentally trigger the easter egg.
All text is now straight from the NES classic game!

data.description:
Watchface for Pebble with our hero Link getting ready for an adventure! 

Features:
-Configurable
-Hearts show the Pebble's battery life (as well as charge state)
-The fires are only lit when you are connected to Bluetooth
-Link is fully animated
-Fire Animations on tap (that can match up with your backlight timing - almost as if it is lighting your watch!)
-A version check after changing settings to know when to update your watch
-Easter Egg: Watch out for Ganon!

latest_release.release_notes: Added Doirite support

data.author: Sam Jerichow

changelog.release_notes: For watch displays shaped like the cross section of the time vortex, this watchface is compatible now!

data.description:
Summary: time telling TARDIS
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

This is a watchface for fans of Doctor Who. I think I don't have to explain the TARDIS, right? I was playing around with some sizes and views and found the isometric view the coolest. Time telling occurs through the door windows. They change throughout the series, so this little adaption shouldn't be a sacrilege. I drew every pixel by myself, trying to achieve the best outcome for the Pebble Time. You can even read "POLICE BOX" if you look super close. This watchface also works for original Pebble but looks really good in color.

 This is a non-commercial use of the blue police box trademarked by the BBC. This is my own interpretation.

Pixeldesign / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

Big thanks to Nev Rawlins who helped me making this become reality.

latest_release.release_notes: For watch displays shaped like the cross section of the time vortex, this watchface is compatible now!

data.title: Tardis

data.author: Dragon Wrath

changelog.release_notes: Changes to Bluetooth indicator and battery.

This is my first watch face... The coding isn't the best. Vibrates and updates corresponding parts of screen on Bluetooth connect and disconnect along with charger connect and disconnect. Has a basic analog clock which uses a large dot to signify the hour (always points to the current hour number (1 - 12) - updates each hour) and a smaller dot to signify the minutes (only points to the current minute number (1 - 12) - updates every five minutes.). Includes a digital clock, local weather in Fahrenheit, and a bar that grows every ten seconds to act as a second hand. Also displays day of week and date. 12 or 24 hour format depending on watch settings.

data.description: This is my first watch face... The coding isn't the best. Includes a digital clock, local weather in Fahrenheit, and a bar that grows every ten seconds to act as a second hand. Also displays day of week and date. 12 or 24 hour format depending on watch settings.

data.author: Dragon Wrath

changelog.release_notes: To change color of face, shake the watch within the first 15 seconds of loading Faze. The white square in the lower left corner shows that the face is not locked on a color yet. After 15 seconds of loading Faze, the white square disappears and the current color is locked. Shaking the watch no longer changes the color at this point. To change the color again, reload the face and shake the watch within the first 15 seconds of loading it.
This version only supports colored watches. The aplite version can be downloaded separately.

data.description:
This is my first watch face... The coding isn't the best. Vibrates and updates corresponding parts of screen on Bluetooth connect and disconnect along with charger connect and disconnect. Has a basic analog clock which uses a large dot to signify the hour (always points to the current hour number (1 - 12) - updates each hour) and a smaller dot to signify the minutes (only points to the current minute number (1 - 12) - updates every five minutes.). Includes a digital clock, local weather in Fahrenheit, and a bar that grows every ten seconds to act as a second hand. Also displays day of week and date. 12 or 24 hour format depending on watch settings. 

This is the colored version of my original face, Faze.
This face has three themes that can be cycled through by flicking the pebble downwards with its face pointing towards the ceiling.

latest_release.release_notes: To change color of face, shake the watch within the first 15 seconds of loading Faze. The white square in the lower left corner shows that the face is not locked on a color yet. After 15 seconds of loading Faze, the white square disappears and the current color is locked. Shaking the watch no longer changes the color at this point. To change the color again, reload the face and shake the watch within the first 15 seconds of loading it.

data.title: Faze Colored

data.author: Andrey Stoev

changelog.release_notes: - changed config page host location
- Added Power-Save Mode config option: changes display refresh rate from 15 sec to 1 min. When Seconds are displayed, Auto-Off at 19:00 until 07:00. Turns Quiet Time Auto-On at 19:00 until 07:00.
- fix for the watchface to be "local DST in Use" aware
- minor design change of the hands

- added Dual-Time DST indicator
- added "non-standard" TMZ offset indicator
- fixed a bug in the TMZ conversion algorithm
- implemented manual DST correction for the Dual-Time Zone
- changes to the quick-select color sets

- added support for "non-standard" Time Zone Offsets - now Time Zones will be properly calculated if the Local Time Zone or the Destination Time Zone or Both are with "Non-Standard" GMT Offset (not an exact hour step). Ex. Nepal is in GMT +5:45
- added ability to customize the color of the minor tick marks (the minute marks between hours)
- added color customization for the dial numerals

- added ability to create a custom color set
- re-organized the color sets - 7 presets + 1 custom
- new config page
- major changes in the code handling colors and persistent storage
- fixed a bug preventing the custom TMZ ID Tag string from properly terminating

- major rework: the entire way of how Config Settings are internally handled and stored (optimized)
- changed Smart Dial behavior: The number "24" will be replaced with "0" past the 24th hour if displayed Dial is 24Hr mode
- added 2 more color sets for Aplite (Monochrome with no Gray)
- design change: added a solid contour line around the gray hour hand on Aplite
- design change for "Aplite"
- changed the 24hr dial hour "dots" from a rotated path to circles

- changed the DT Offset behavior for SDK3 - Offset is now the actual Time Zone from GMT (example 0 = GMT)
- DST is not accounted for
- SDK2.x -  Offset is from Local Time as before.
- removed D+/D- indicator; The calendar window will now reflect the Day correction during DT
- date in the calendar window will change color if there is a Day correction during DT display

- added Dual Time Zone text label - max 3 characters
- if TZ label field is empty, the watch will display the time offset instead
- If TZ offset is 0, DOW will be displayed instead
- shorter settings confirmation vibe to prevent accidental trigger of the flick/tap service
- bug fix for the Smart Dial in DT mode
- fixed a bug preventing the date window to move during Dual Time

- added a Dual Time feature; allows to add a second, manually configurable Time Zone (-12 to +12hrs offset).
- when DT is activated, secondary clock is displayed on Flick/Tap alongside the actual TZ shift.
- +D / -D indicator shows if the displayed time is during the next / previous day
- Added functionality: in 12Hr mode, the center shaft serves as an AM/PM indicator

data.description:
The definitive analog watchface for aviation professionals / pilots.
Torgoen T10 inspired watchface (very similar to Bell & Ross 03-92), designed after Aircraft Instruments for an improved readability. 
This version is compiled with the latest SDK and adds many new features, color for Pebble Time / Time Round (TH10r) and various user-configurable settings.
Ultimate color customization - 7 color presets + 1 user-defined color set and a High-Contrast color variant. 11 color customizeable dial elements.
High level of feature customization via a configuration menu with 18 options - Invert Date, Hourly Vibrate, Use "0" Hours instead of "24", Force to 12Hr Mode, Show Seconds,  Bluetooth Connection Status - Visual and/or Haptic, Alternative Hands style (Hollow), Battery Meter, High-Contrast display, Simple Dial, Hide Date,Tap/Flick for Day of The Week, "Submarine Dial" (True 24hr mode), Power-Save Mode and a user-configurable Secondary Time Zone (Dual-Time) with a Custom ID Tag. The World Clock capability is configured as Time Zone offset from GMT and supports manual DST and "non-standard" offsets.
There is an inconspicuous Battery Meter, showing battery charge levels from 10% to >80% (8 steps, one level for 80, 90 and 100%).
Credits:
Original 1.0 by Hudson, version 2.0 by Jnmattern /w additional features by Roger Dodger.

HourBG Shows the current hour front and centre. Minutes are represented by the background which grows left to right as a percentage of the current hour passed.
The BG changes colour for each minute.

data.description: Inspired by the HUD used in Persona 4, this watchface is a labor of love-style tribute that also provides real world functionality. Featuring: 12/24 hr time, hourly weather updates via geo location, Animated 3 day forecast displaying the day's morning & evening weather (forecast can be triggered by Y or Z axis acceleration), & persistent storage of current weather forecast. for Android & iOS

data.author: BOBdotEXE

changelog.release_notes: updated to pebble sdk 4

+Now updated/optimized for Pebble OS 3.8! 
+Updated to 'Navi Engine 2.8' (the same version all custom PET's will use) 
+Minor bug fixes 
+Minor timing fixes 
+NEW icon that shows when watch is disconnected
+MUCH more precise Bluetooth status checking!
+First OPEN SOURCE Release!

V0.44 (Extra Code Enabled!)
+Faster updates on battery level. (Live updates)
 
+New 'charging' indicator.
 
+uses less cpu power, and a little less battery.
 
 
known bugs:
-'bt disconnected ' visual indicator is still broken (same with 0.43)

+new clock animation timing.
(let me know what you think!)


+Battery display now turns red when you're low on battery (<21%)

+As suggested by 'Joshua Ols', the battery indicator has been replaced with an 'HP box style display.
For now it's in the right, but when the config option comes out, you may be able to move it to the top left if you chose.
+The HP is SUPPOSED to turn red when your battery reaches 20 or 10% but for now, it only dose it at 20%
+The font has been changed, the '9' looks a bit too much like a '4' imo, but it's the best I could find atm to replicate the bn hp font.
*I'll try to get at least one more update out that fixes both issues before I start work on the revamp, for the config update.
but as I am much more busy now. the updates will be much slower.

Initial (Beta) Release.
-Blink animation still need work
-animation timing configuration ready, but not implemented yet.

data.description:
Your very own NetNavi! 
With multiple animations, Blinking, 'jack out' when you return to the main screen,
collapsing clock too!
This watch face show the time of day (12hr/24hr format supported)
As well as the Date, day of week, and battery level! 
Helmet color changes when bluetooth is not connected.
(colors darkened to improve image quality on real pebble time)

Almost 2 months of coding when into this project, and now I finally have a beta ready for release!
What started as a slight modification of a tutorial, has turned in to quite a complex watch face!
 600+ lines of code 14 resources, and 60+ hours of coding, and there's still more to do!

(check the website for the most up to date info, and to follow the progress)

*The background and navi images are modified images from 'rockman operation shooting star' that game, and the images are copyright by Capcom.
Both images were ripped by me personally, from my own personal copy of the game. 
*the title show 'PEbble Termial' is a joke, this is in NO WAY associated with Pebble Technology Corp.

latest_release.release_notes: updated to pebble sdk 4

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: minimalistic block number isometry
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

This watchface is made of blocky numbers built up from the depth of your wrist. They are presented in an isometry view. There are only two shades that shape the numbers. The appareance is rather 2D but once your eyes adapted, you see the 3D numbers. 

If you like minimalism, 2D graphics and blocks, Up might be for you.

Design : Sam Jerichow Programming : Sam Jerichow
Copyright © 2013, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: Up C

data.author: Cody Doremus

changelog.release_notes: Bug fix: Properly checking if images exist so I don't make double and I only delete created images.

Updated the name since I added a "Light" version of the same watchface. This is the Orange on Black version. The "Light" is the reverse.

Menu icons and names are being adjusted so that my watchfaces are more easily identifiable. The shrunk screenshot is not super helpful if you are switching between the full and lite versions to save battery or get more information. The menu icon will now have the initials of the Precisioneer type (PLd for Precisioneer Lite:Dark).
Initial release. Precisioneer layout with bigger time font.

data.description:
Like the Precisioneer Color layout but are away from your charger and need to cut down on battery consumption? Use Precisioneer Lite. This is the "Dark" version. Black on Orange is available in the "Light" version.

No weather or settings but still with the short long short vibration for a phone disconnect and battery monitoring.

Special icon when the Battery is charging. Medium and Low battery icons at 40% and 20% respectively.

AM/PM only shows up in 12 hour format.

VCR_OSD_MONO by Riciery Leal

Give it a heart of you like it!

latest_release.release_notes: Bug fix: Properly checking if images exist so I don't make double and I only delete created images.

data.title: Precisioneer Lite: Dark
